intro: Andryala rothia subsp. cossyrensis, commonly known as the Cossyrense Andryala, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of soft hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
